info.title: IRIDA REST API
info.description: The IRIDA REST API follows a standard output format, regardless of the resource being accessed. Resources can be accessed as an individual resource or as part of a resource collection.

get.summary: Find the metadata for a given sample
get.description: Get the metadata for a given sample.

put.summary: Add new metadata fields for a given sample
put.description: Add new metadata fields for a given sample.

post.summary: Save the metadata for a given sample
post.description: Save the metadata for a given sample.

get.summary: Lists all users
get.description: Lists all users.

post.summary: Link a sequencing run with a sequence file
post.description: Add a relationship between a sequencing run and a sequence file.

get.summary: Lists all sequencing runs
get.description: Lists all sequencing runs.

get.summary: Find the sequence files for a given sample
get.description: Get the sequence files for a given sample.

post.summary: Add a new sequence file to the given sample
post.description: Add a new sequence file to the given sample.

post.summary: Add a new pair of sequence files to the given sample
post.description: Add a new pair of sequence files to the given sample.

post.summary: Add a new fast5 file to the given sample
post.description: Add a new fast5 file to the given sample.

get.summary: Find all the genome assemblies for a given sample
get.description: Get all the genome assemblies for a given sample.

post.summary: Upload a new genome assembly for a given sample
post.description: Upload a new genome assemblies for a given sample.

get.summary: Get all users for the given a project
get.description: Get all users for the given a project.

get.summary: Find all samples for the given project
get.description: Get all samples for the given project.

post.summary: Create a new sample and add it to the given project
post.description: Create a new sample and add it to the given project.
